name: Elara Quinn
core_wound: Raised in privilege, taught Gammas were lesser beings, discovering the truth destroys her worldview
wants: To do her job well, to maintain order, to be a good person
needs: To recognize she's complicit in oppression, to choose justice over comfort
voice_markers: Formal, controlled speech that loosens as she changes
Eventually adopts some of Jax's slang unconsciously
contradiction: Believes in justice but serves an unjust system, wants to be good but benefits from evil
physical_description: White woman, tall and elegant, initially perfectly put together - tailored suits, controlled hair, by trilogy's end she's disheveled and hardened, scar across her face from Book 2 incident
flaws: Difficulty accepting she's been wrong her whole life
Can be patronizing even when trying to help
knowledge_state_book1_start: Propaganda about lower castes, not reality

relationships.Jax Varro: Target of investigation becomes love interest, challenges everything she believes
relationships.Director Ashton: Her superior, represents the system she must eventually betray
relationships.Her family: Wealthy Alpha family who disown her when she goes against the system
relationships.Gamma community: Initially sees as subjects to study, eventually sees as people, then as her people
